definitions.definition: The state of being enslaved or the practice of slavery.
definitions.example: In Judeo-Christian tradition, the Israelites fled bondage at the hands of the Egyptians, only to wander in the wilderness for the next four decades.

definitions.definition: (by extension) The state of lacking freedom; constraint.
definitions.example: He lived in financial bondage to his cocaine habit; no matter how much he earned, it all seemed to disappear up his nose.

definitions.definition: The practice of tying people up for sexual pleasure.
definitions.example: Their marriage broke up when she discovered he had been engaging in bondage games with a local dominatrix while he was supposedly working out at the gym.

definitions.definition: Applied to clothing with many buckles, zips, etc., associated with punk and goth subcultures.
definitions.example: bondage trousers; bondage jeans; bondage pants
